title: [gdk-pixbuf] can't build without tiff, libjpeg and libpng as expected

labels.name: category:port-feature
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is requesting new capabilities that didnâ€™t exist

body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I'm trying to install 'gdk-pixbuf' without depending on the 'tiff' library (and/or without 'libjpeg' and 'libpng')

This should work on a recent Fedora Linux AND on Windows.
It should also be possible for 'gdk-pixbuf' to be built without 'libjpeg' and 'libpng'.

See also
https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/38033

The following two variants were run on a recently updated Fedora 38 Linux,
directly in an empty directory after a git clone of the vcpkg project and the vcpkg-bootstrap.sh run.

Variant 1 (Fedora 38 run). The following installs 'tiff' as a component
```
[user@fedora vcpkg]$ ./vcpkg --disable-metrics install gdk-pixbuf[jpeg,png]
Computing installation plan...
A suitable version of cmake was not found (required v3.29.0) Downloading portable cmake 3.29.0...
Downloading cmake...
https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/releases/download/v3.29.0/cmake-3.29.0-linux-x86_64.tar.gz->/home/mauteand/tmp-vcpkg/vcpkg/vcpkg/downloads/cmake-3.29.0-linux-x86_64.tar.gz
Extracting cmake...
The following packages will be built and installed:
  * dirent:x64-linux@1.24
    gdk-pixbuf[core,jpeg,png,tiff]:x64-linux@2.42.10#4
  * gettext:x64-linux@0.22.5
  * gettext-libintl:x64-linux@0.22.5
  * glib:x64-linux@2.78.4#1
  * libffi:x64-linux@3.4.6
  * libiconv:x64-linux@1.17#3
  * libjpeg-turbo:x64-linux@3.0.2
  * liblzma:x64-linux@5.4.4
  * libpng:x64-linux@1.6.43
  * pcre2[core,jit,platform-default-features]:x64-linux@10.42#3
  * tiff[core,jpeg,lzma,zip]:x64-linux@4.6.0#4
  * vcpkg-cmake:x64-linux@2023-05-04
  * vcpkg-cmake-config:x64-linux@2022-02-06#1
  * vcpkg-cmake-get-vars:x64-linux@2023-12-31
  * vcpkg-tool-meson:x64-linux@1.3.2#2
  * zlib:x64-linux@1.3.1
```

Variant 2 (Fedora 38). This one also installs 'tiff' as a component, though the 'gdk-pixbuf' line doesn't mention it.
```
[user@fedora vcpkg]$ ./vcpkg --disable-metrics install gdk-pixbuf[core,jpeg,png]
Computing installation plan...
A suitable version of cmake was not found (required v3.29.0) Downloading portable cmake 3.29.0...
Downloading cmake...
https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/releases/download/v3.29.0/cmake-3.29.0-linux-x86_64.tar.gz->/home/mauteand/tmp-vcpkg/vcpkg/vcpkg/downloads/cmake-3.29.0-linux-x86_64.tar.gz
Extracting cmake...
The following packages will be built and installed:
  * dirent:x64-linux@1.24
    gdk-pixbuf[core,jpeg,png]:x64-linux@2.42.10#4
  * gettext:x64-linux@0.22.5
  * gettext-libintl:x64-linux@0.22.5
  * glib:x64-linux@2.78.4#1
  * libffi:x64-linux@3.4.6
  * libiconv:x64-linux@1.17#3
  * libjpeg-turbo:x64-linux@3.0.2
  * liblzma:x64-linux@5.4.4
  * libpng:x64-linux@1.6.43
  * pcre2[core,jit,platform-default-features]:x64-linux@10.42#3
  * tiff[core,jpeg,lzma,zip]:x64-linux@4.6.0#4
  * vcpkg-cmake:x64-linux@2023-05-04
  * vcpkg-cmake-config:x64-linux@2022-02-06#1
  * vcpkg-cmake-get-vars:x64-linux@2023-12-31
  * vcpkg-tool-meson:x64-linux@1.3.2#2
  * zlib:x64-linux@1.3.1
```


### Proposed solution

change the port so that it supports a 'gdk-pixbuf' built without these dependencies
